bill_title: create a tobacco settlement fund and to replace the potential loss of inheritance tax revenue.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create a tobacco settlement fund and to replace the potential loss of inheritance tax revenue. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The tobacco settlement fund is established in the state treasury. Any money received from the Master Settlement Agreement signed on November 23, 1998, by the attorneys general of several states and by various tobacco companies shall be deposited in the tobacco settlement fund. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited in the tobacco settlement fund. Section 2. There is hereby annually appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund created in section 1 of this Act the sum of twenty million dollars ($20,000,000) to the general fund. Section 3. This Act is effective on July 1, 2001, if Constitutional Amendment C which prohibits a state inheritance tax is approved at the next general election. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
